intro: Evodianthus funifer subsp. fendlerianus, commonly known as the Fendler's evodianthus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are often narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
